document_title: What is gonorrhea? Causes and warning signs
subsection_name: benh-lau.json_2_What is the transmission route of gonorrhea?
subsection_content: Gonorrhea is transmitted through sexual contact when the partner's penis, vagina, mouth or anus is infected, even without ejaculation. In addition, this condition can also be transmitted from mother to child during vaginal birth. People who have had the disease and are treated are still at risk of reinfection if they continue to have sex with an infected person.
subsection_title: benh lau.json. What is the transmission route of gonorrhea?
subsection_data:
benh lau.json. What is the transmission route of gonorrhea?
Gonorrhea is transmitted through sexual contact when the partner's penis, vagina, mouth or anus is infected, even without ejaculation. In addition, this condition can also be transmitted from mother to child during vaginal birth. People who have had the disease and are treated are still at risk of reinfection if they continue to have sex with an infected person.
